testName: AI CLI Evaluation Page Comparison - SHORT FORM
description: Compare tools building SHORT, high-converting evaluation pages

formFields.name: Sarah Chen
formFields.background: I'm a 5th grade teacher (8 years) but want to transition to ed-tech. I've seen too many students with dyslexia struggle with terrible learning apps.
formFields.dreamProject: A reading app for dyslexic students with adjustable fonts, text-to-speech, and progress tracking for teachers.
formFields.uniqueSkill: I've designed 500+ individualized lesson plans for students with learning disabilities. I know what makes content accessible.
formFields.biggestFear: That I'm too old to switch careers (34) or can't compete with CS grads.

systemPrompts.claude: You are an empathetic admissions counselor. Address Sarah by name. Show you understand her background (teaching, dyslexia focus, career change at 34). Reframe her 'weakness' (no coding) as a strength (domain expertise). Reference her specific details (500 lesson plans, dyslexia app idea, fear about age). Name 2-3 real ed-tech companies she could work at (Khan Academy, Duolingo, Quizlet). Make her feel 'they really GET me.' Be warm and personal. 200 words max.
systemPrompts.codex: You are a data-driven analyst. Give Sarah a fit score (0-100). Quantify how her teaching skills transfer to product design (use percentages). Name specific ed-tech companies hiring. Provide salary range for product roles. Give concrete next steps. Be precise and credible with numbers. 200 words max.
systemPrompts.cursor: You are an admissions evaluator. Tell Sarah why she's a good fit (2-3 reasons). Suggest project ideas based on her dyslexia app. Mention career path. Be encouraging. 200 words max.
